llm_text:
Why:
- payment_format_ach (value=1) had the largest positive contribution (SHAP 2.88242 → increase), so ACH routing is the primary driver of the flag.
- payment_currency_saudi_riyal (value=1; SHAP 0.614287 → increase) and receiving_currency_saudi_riyal (value=1; SHAP 0.321576 → increase) both increased risk, indicating the payment and receipt are in Saudi riyals.
- amount_received (43845.9; SHAP 0.435789 → increase) and amount_paid (43845.9; SHAP 0.258219 → increase) add further upward pressure due to the transaction size.
- to_bank (49508; SHAP -0.373065 → decrease) and from_bank (249176; SHAP -0.352082 → decrease) reduced the model score and partially mitigated the flag.

Conclusion:
The model flagged this transaction mainly because it is an ACH transfer (payment_format_ach=1) conducted in Saudi riyals (payment_currency_saudi_riyal=1 and receiving_currency_saudi_riyal=1) with a material amount (amount_received=43845.9). The specific to_bank and from_bank values lowered the score but did not offset the positive drivers. If one treats same-currency SAR ACH transfers of this size as higher risk, that aligns with the model’s rationale.
